Articles.Content: Hi everyone! my name is Oarum, and I have been playing kerbal space program ever since .21 2.1? I forget. So, you might say that I'm ALRIGHT at KSP, I've landed on Duna, on both of Kerbin's moons, and I am planning to go to Eve soon (this is all in career mode). So, yeah, only joined the forums recently, and I found that everything here is amazing, so here to stay. Also, proud member of B.R.I.Xco!. I would LOVE it if someone could give me some handy tips (and yes, I know how to do docking, manoeuvre nodes, interplanetary travel, and a few other things. What I would like to know is if someone could give me some advice on how to build rovers and bases. Thanks!
Hello. Good luck on your trip to eve. Eve is easier to get to then Duna but is terrifying to get off of. Good luck on your mission!

Hi. Welcome to the forums.

You'll never get off of from Eve.

You'll never get off of from Eve.

don't tell my kerbals this, but I never intended to. I'm gonna get all of the science by just leaving the kerbals there and saying 'transmit the data thank you!' kinda sad. but when I unlock new stuff totally worth it. I'm evil

don't tell my kerbals this, but I never intended to. I'm gonna get all of the science by just leaving the kerbals there and saying 'transmit the data thank you!' kinda sad. but when I unlock new stuff totally worth it. I'm evil

Don't forget to bring a processing lab if you want to do that

And you're not evil. You're just starting colonization of Eve
When you land kerbals on Eve, call it a base. No one will ever know...
